channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Female surfer, 35, is mauled by an enormous shark on Shelly Beach NSW
item.description: A female surfer has been mauled by an enormous shark on at a popular beach on the New South Wales coast.

item.title: Couple who paid nearly £1,000 to beat quarantine deadline are among thousands forced to flee France
item.description: Thousands of UK holidays have been dashed as panicked Brits desperate to avoid having to self-isolate for 14 days from France flee the European country.

item.title: Meghan Markle decries the 'toxicity' she has faced in the media
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, interviewed The 19th* co-founder and CEO Emily Ramshaw. The 19th* is a nonprofit, nonpartisan newsroom focused on gender and politics.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Harry Enfield leaves his wife of 23 years who once hailed his 'huge sex appeal'
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Harry Enfield's wife, Lucy, once hailed his 'huge sex appeal' but she's now found that life with the celebrated comedian is no laughing matter.

item.title: Testing travellers on arrival in Britain and again later on 'could reduce quarantine time'
item.description: Documents from UK's SAGE group show that show that when arrivals are 'double tested', there's hardly any difference between quarantining for ten days compared to a fortnight.

item.title: Twin sisters married to twin brothers are both PREGNANT
item.description: Twins Brittany and Briana Deane, 33, married identical brothers Josh and Jeremy Salyers, 35, in a double wedding in 2018. Now both couples are expecting babies at the same time.

item.title: UK staycation bookings soar AGAIN over the past 24 hours
item.description: One travel company saw its web traffic increase by 25 per cent on Friday after it was announced that arrivals to the UK from France (pictured) and other countries would have to self-isolate for 14 days.

item.title: New South Wales records nine new cases of coronavirus
item.description: Of the new cases two are staff members from Chopstix Asian Cuisine in Smithfield RSL.

item.title: New Zealand records seven new cases of coronavirus overnight as Jetstar cancels all flights
item.description: New Zealand's Ministry of Health Director-General Dr Ashley Bloomfield and Health Minister Chris Hipkins announced the country recorded seven new coronavirus cases on Saturday morning.

item.title: Trump says 'every city will be under siege' if Joe and Kamala win and tells cops to 'fight back'
item.description: Donald Trump has told a gathering of 'Cops for Trump' at his Bedminster golf club that 'no one will be safe' if Joe Biden wins. Trump was presented with a statue by the police union president.

item.title: America's super rich throw parties and escape on private jets amid COVID-19
item.description: While the US continues to battle the highest number of cases globally and 1,000 Americans are dying a day, Silicon Valley's elite have been carrying on with their lives and socializing as if it was normal.

item.title: How Lucy Wyndham-Read suffered heartbreak aged 21 when her fiancé died while playing around with gun
item.description: At just 5ft 3in and a dress size eight, Lucy Wyndham-Read is a tiny presence but one who packs a formidable punch - metaphorically speaking.

item.title: 'Skinny house' that measures just THREE FEET on one side sells for $260,000 in Illinois
item.description: A 'Pie House' in Deerfield, Illinois, sold for $260,000 on Friday after it went viral on Tik Tok for its slender size. One of the two-bedroom home's sides measures just three-feet in width.

item.title: ANOTHER day of thunderstorms: Britain is braced for travel chaos, road closures and power cuts
item.description: From today through to Monday there will be a constant deluge of rainfall working its way from the south of England up to Wales and as far north as Hull as Britons are lashed with up to 70mm of rain.

item.title: £6.85m foreign aid scheme accused of 'funnelling aid to firms'
item.description: Working with charities including Care UK, the scheme promises to help workers living in Myanmar, Bangladesh, Kenya, Uganda, Ethiopia, Tanzania, Rwanda and Ghana.

item.title: Questions raised after former builder used fake CVs to become an NHS boss and make £1million
item.description: Jon Andrewes, 67, told 'staggering lies' on his CVs to become an NHS boss. Considering how easily he fooled his bosses, the question is: How many other CV conmen are still out there?

item.title: Nearly 3,000 Oxford graduates urge university to admit students hit by downgraded A-levels
item.description: Oxford alumni called on the university to show 'kindness and generosity' to students whose marks had been 'unexpectedly and unfairly downgraded by an algorithm'.

item.title: Film reveals impact of Trump's plans and his organisation's treatment of those who lived nearby
item.description: Documentary film maker Anthony Baxter made You've Been Trumped Too to reveal the consequences of his ambitious plans in Scotland after residents were left without water

item.title: Young Army officers must be 'more unconventional' in warfare and master 'cyber and space'
item.description: The Defence Secretary Ben Wallace told Sandhurst graduates that the highly anticipated Integrated Defence and Security review will bring with it new expectations of officers.

item.title: ANTONIA HOYLE and her family try hundreds of new taste-alike products
item.description: ANTONIA HOYLE: In a bid to stop Waitrose fans deserting Ocado in their droves, M&S is introducing similar versions of some of Waitrose's bestselling products.

item.title: Never use a dog nappy to tint your eyelashes!
item.description: TRINNY WOODALL: During lockdown, with salons closed, many women feared for their beauty regimes.

item.title: No need for your poker face! Casino dealers will hand out cards face up as part of Covid measures
item.description: Casinos to reopen from today but new safety measures could alter the game. Dealers will hand out cards face up to stop players from touching the cards which is said to suit card games like Blackjack.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Prince Charles welcomes back bed-and-breakfast guests to Dumfries House
item.description: The Prince of Wales is welcoming bed-and-breakfast guests to his Scottish stately home, Dumfries House, again, but with a significant change.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: Cressida Bonas's pop at Harry's £11million palace?
item.description: While Prince Harry and Meghan have spent £11 million on a mansion with nine bedrooms and 16 bathrooms (right), his ex, Cressida Bonas, is keen to make the point that she's happy with a simpler life.

item.title: Obama: Trump aims to 'kneecap Post Office' to discourage voters
item.description: Barack Obama slammed President Donald Trump for trying to 'actively kneecap' the postal service to disenfranchise voters.

item.title: Classical guitarist and lute player Julian Bream who won four Grammy Awards dies aged 87
item.description: Bream was among the most distinguished classical guitarists of the 20th century and worked with some of the period's best-known musicians and composers.

item.title: More than 1,800 Post Office employees may have been wrongfully accused of taking money from the till
item.description: Hundreds of postmasters were sacked, went bankrupt or were wrongfully convicted after amounts appeared to vanish from their tills.

item.title: SARAH VINE says the chaos and incompetence over this week's A-level results is the final betrayal
item.description: SARAH VINE slams 'chaos and incompetence' behind this week's grade fiasco as the final betrayal of disadvantaged children hit hardest by lockdown

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's mother talks of his legacy on anniversary
item.description: Pc Harper's family and Thames Valley Police officers gathered on Friday for services and a minute of silence. His mother Debbie Adlam attended a memorial in Berkshire, to mark the anniversary

item.title: Losing weight before middle age 'can halve death risk'
item.description: Reductions in body mass index between these two life stages is critical to extending lifespan, US researchers reveal.

item.title: Man gets revenge on fly-tipper who dumped 400 tyres on his land
item.description: A farmer plagued by a fly-tipper who dumped 421 tyres on his land got his own back - after placing them in a truck and depositing them back on HIS doorstep

item.title: Pink cars grow more popular among UK drivers joining the likes of Paris Hilton and Nicki Minaj
item.description: An increasing number of celebrities, including Paris Hilton, Nicki Minaj (pictured) and Katie Price have recently been seen with luxury pink cars.

item.title: Woman, 33, who punched a court usher and tried to headbutt a police officer is jailed for a year
item.description: Kimberley Walker, 33, had been waiting at Blackpool Magistrates' Court when the female usher came to collect her. As she did so, Walker launched at the woman, punching her to the right side of the face.

item.title: Rolling Stones guitarist Ronnie Wood believes a special 'valve' in his brain stopped him overdosing
item.description: The Rolling Stones guitarist, 73, claims that a circuit breaker saved him from going too far during his infamous blow-outs in the 1970s and 80s.

item.title: BBC to crack down on use of 'racially insulting language' after N-word row
item.description: BBC editorial director Kamal Ahmed told staff any racist language on news and current affairs shows should be referred to director of news Fran Unsworth (pictured).

item.title: Students fear no university until 2021...even if they win their A-level appeal
item.description: Lucy Lipfriend (right) thinks her grades were downgraded because of last year's performance, taken after her mother's breast cancer diagnosis, being taken into account.

item.title: Woman bakes cake that looks identical to a dirty dish sponge
item.description: Abi, a 20-year-old amateur baker, shared footage of herself munching on the cake before giving a behind-the-scenes look at how it was made.

item.title: Army commander, 51, caught cheating during lockdown is cleared of breaking social distancing rules
item.description: Major General Rupert Jones previously Britain's highest-ranking soldier in Iraq, was accused of breaking the rules to carry out his affair with his married lover.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Trevor Engelson's uncle hits back at claim Meghan Markle's first husband couldn't cope with her fame
item.description: Meghan Markle and Trevor Engelson were inseparable boyfriend and girlfriend before just 23 months of marriage and a sudden split but the reasons why have always remained undisclosed.

item.title: What aircraft gunner Paul Newman said after nuclear attacks on Japan ended the war 75 years ago
item.description: As Britain marks the anniversary of Victory over Japan (VJ) today, the Mail shares the memories from that historic day, including some of the worst experiences of the war in the Far East ..

item.title: Huge fire breaks out at Birmingham's Cadbury Club
item.description: More than 50 firefighters were brought in to tackle the blaze at Cadbury Club in Bournville, south Birmingham, a sports and social club for the chocolate company's employees.

item.title: Average HS2 worker costs the taxpayer £94,824 a year
item.description: The figures will raise fresh questions over the huge costs of the HS2 project, which have already spiralled out of control from £36billion in 2012 to an estimated £106billion.

item.title: UFO bass player Pete Way has died aged 69 after suffering 'life threatening' injuries
item.description: The legendary founder of the iconic rock band died with his wife Jenny by his side on Friday morning.

item.title: Parents face warning over hidden risk of child seats in holiday hire cars
item.description: The survey of 1,800 parents by consumer group Which? found that more than half admitted they still used the seat despite the potential danger.

item.title: Just Eat will stop using gig economy workers to deliver food, firm's boss says
item.description: Jitse Groen, chief executive of the food delivery giant, revealed he would prefer to give his staff more benefits in light of the difficulties they have faced since the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: UK coronavirus: More deaths announced on Friday
item.description: Department of Health statistics show the daily spike in cases is the largest 24-hour jump since 1,514 people were diagnosed with the life-threatening disease on June 14.

item.title: Missing 6ft bird is reunited with her owner... then goes on the run AGAIN two days later
item.description: Ethel the emu has gone on the run from her home near Doncaster, South Yorkshire, for the second time in a week, to the bemusement of locals, the police and the RSPCA.

item.title: Royal Family and Boris Johnson will join Second World War veterans to mark 75 years since VJ Day
item.description: The Prime Minister and the Royal Family will be joined by nine other world leaders, including Donald Trump, in making Victory in Japan day which took place on August 15, 1945 and ended World War Two

item.title: Julian Assange's lawyers 'astonished' by new US charges
item.description: The US Government made a fresh extradition request to have the WikiLeaks founder sent from the UK based on charges in a new superseding indictment.

item.title: Convicted Troubles terrorists excluded from victims' compensation payments
item.description: Sinn Fein is boycotting the initiative because it believes the UK Government's approach could exclude thousands of injured people from Northern Ireland's republican community.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry's new neighbors
item.description: Meghan and Harry bought the nine-bedroom and 16-bathroom mansion in the secluded area of Riven Rock in upscale Montecito in June for $14.65M.

item.title: Kenya's elephant numbers have more than doubled since 1989
item.description: The number of elephants in Kenya has soared to more than 34,000 as of 2018, officials said

item.title: Happy birthday Princess Royal! Elegant Anne stuns in three new portraits to mark turning 70
item.description: The Princess Royal's 70th birthday has been marked with the release of three official photographs taken at her Gatcombe Park home in Gloucestershire. to celebrate the milestone.

item.title: Fewer students have found university places through clearing
item.description: More than 13,000 applicants have been accepted on to degree courses through the annual process - down 24% on the same point last year.

item.title: BREAKING NEWS: Donald Trump's brother Robert hospitalized
item.description: White House officials on Friday confirmed President Trump's younger brother, Robert, 72, has been admitted to the hospital in New York. He was described as 'very ill', but his condition is unknown.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's widow Lissie reveals her torment
item.description: Exactly a year ago Lissie Harper, a beautiful young newlywed, was woken in the early hours by a loud knock on her front door.

item.title: Exclusive first look at All Creatures Great and Small
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: All Creatures Great and Small returns to screens on Channel 5 this September after a 30-year absence. The first trailer, shared exclusively with FEMAIL, shows romance blossoming.

item.title: Soon-to-be Lord Botham speaks out on 'jealous' carping over his peerage
item.description: Today, their marriage is one of the strongest in sport but Lord Botham concedes it's 'a miracle' he and his wife Kath have celebrated more than 40 years together.

item.title: Breast cancer patients face 'cruel' postcode lottery for fertility treatment
item.description: Chemotherapy given to young women with breast cancer can leave them infertile, meaning many choose to freeze an embryo or their eggs for future IVF (file photo).

item.title: Now all schools will be able to appeal for FREE against A-level grades
item.description: The UK's under-fire education secretary Gavin Williamson said that the government would cover the appeal costs to ensure that head teachers are not put off from making appeals by the cost.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: I couldn't work with Prince Harry when he guest edited BBC Radio 4's Today programme
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: I knew what would happen. I would want to ask what his minders would regard as impertinent or embarrassing questions and that would be the end of that.

item.title: Michael Cohen seen after bombshell details from book revealed
item.description: DailyMail.com spotted Michael Cohen in New York City on Friday, the day after he published a sneak of 'Disloyal' - his upcoming memoir about his years-long relationship with Donald Trump.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... A-levels chaos and the France quarantine
item.description: 'What do you mean your French A-level isn't good enough to get us on the last ferry before quarantine?'

item.title: AMANDA PLATELL: Police close the Stephen Lawrence murder case, but I pray this isn't the end
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: Had he not been stabbed to death by racist thugs at a bus stop on April 22, 1993, Stephen Lawrence would now be 45 years old.

item.title: NASA-backed mobile gravity suit helps astronauts fight health hazards of zero-gravity space flight
item.description: Neeki Ashari, a graduate bioengineering student at University of California San Diego, designed a 'mobile gravity suit' to combat the loss of bone and muscle density associated with space travel.
item.media:credit: Neeki Ashari and Alan R. Hargens

item.title: Frank Lampard and wife Christine rush back from their family holiday in France to avoid quarantine
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Frank Lampard has avoided having to go into a two-week quarantine and miss the start of Chelsea's pre-season by returning home from his holiday in France.

item.title: Trump compared to mob boss and branded a lying sex cheat in bombshell book by lawyer
item.description: The President's longtime 'fixer' Michael Cohen has promised to spill the beans on Mr Trump's sordid secrets in his new book - called Disloyal - and boasts that he 'knows where the skeletons are'

item.title: Make sure children get lifesaving jabs to avoid piling more pressure on the NHS, parents are urged
item.description: Parents are not taking their children for routine vaccinations as many have put it off during the coronavirus epidemic. Only 1 in 4 parents feel comfortable taking their child to a GP surgery.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: SAGE fear public toilets will harbour virus
item.description: Scientists advising the British Government warned public toilets can become crowded and are likely to harbour the virus on numerous cold surfaces.

item.title: Bidder pays £468,000 for Michael Jordan's old Nike trainers
item.description: The Nike Air Jordan 1 Highs are now the most expensive pair to be sold at auction. Jordan wore them during a match where he dunked the ball so hard it shattered the glass backboard.

item.title: Pilfering at the Palace: Police arrest Queen's servant after a spate of thefts
item.description: The Companion of the Order of the Bath medal belonging to the Master of the Household, Tony Johnstone-Burt OBE, was discovered listed on the auction website for £350.

item.title: Denise Van Outen, 45, reveals she is gearing up for the menopause with oestrogen-boosting gels
item.description: Denise Van Outen, 45, poses in fishnets and tassels as she reveals she is combating the onset of menopause with the use of unregulated bioidentical gels. Says she 'felt great' again since taking them.

item.title: Two boys are robbed at GUNPOINT by teen at lemonade stand
item.description: Surveillance video captured the moment Jude Peterson and his friend were robbed outside his home in Peoria, southwest of Chicago, last Friday afternoon.

item.title: Dog 'bit a woman on the arm as she tried to shield her terrier'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The victim, known as Zoe, 44, claims she was left with 'a hole in her arm' after she tried to separate the leadless bullmastiff from her pet at around 8.30pm on July 16.

item.title: Britain's economy on course for rapid recovery, predicts Bank of England chief
item.description: Chief economist Andy Haldane (pictured) says strong consumer spending has already helped the UK claw back as much as half of the losses triggered by the pandemic.

item.title: Only THREE PER CENT of staff at Department of Education headquarters were in work on results day
item.description: Only 3 per cent of staff in London turned up to the Department for Education headquarters in Whitehall on Thursday, the Daily Mail can reveal.

item.title: Thousands of schools to defy union 'scaremongering' and open full-time from next month
item.description: Town halls across England have worked with schools to draw up detailed plans on how to keep pupils and staff safe and have overwhelmingly pledged a return.

item.title: Swimmer to cross the Channel and stay in France for just TEN MINUTES to avoid quarantine
item.description: The quarantine rules have left swimmer Chloe McCardel holding her breath - as the rising tide of Covid cases on the continent may force her into self-isolation.

item.title: Baffling riddle that most Harvard grads struggle to answer stumps TikTok
item.description: Jack Fanshawe, 22, from New York, took to TikTok on Thursday to recite what has become known as the 'I turn polar bears white' riddle online.

item.title: College football team pulls a woman to safety after she became trapped by her HAIR over a Utah cliff
item.description: Dixie State University football team shared videos of the moment their players rushed to rescue a woman trapped in climbing equipment by her hair over a 70ft Utah cliff on August 7.

item.title: Coronavirus: Cough detection camera could track symptoms
item.description: Korean researchers have created software that can help hospital workers track patients and their cough symptoms during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: McDonald's is testing delivering takeaways to customer's CARS after long drive-thru queues
item.description: McDonald's is trialling a new car delivery service in Royston, Biggleswade and Lytham. Customers order from the McDonald's app, park in the car park and have the food delivered straight to their window.

item.title: Lanarkshire NHS board's transitioners' policy was 'unlawful'
item.description: Sarah Phillimore, 49, from London, criticised NHS Lanarkshire over their 'Supporting Trans Staff in the Workplace policy', which relates to female shared toilet, shower and changing room facilities.

item.title: Divorcee is awarded Russian billionaire ex-husband's £340m superyacht and £110m art collection
item.description: Tatiana Akhmedova, who lives in London, was awarded a 41.5% share of businessman Farkhad Akhmedov's £1 billion-plus fortune by a British judge in late 2016 but has so far only received £5 million

item.title: Many animals practice social distancing when illness is detected in their group
item.description: Many members of the animal kingdom practice social distancing if they perceive sickness among the group - including monkeys, birds, lobsters and insects, a new study reveals.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: How do I tell my family I'm dating a divorced dad-of-three?
item.description: This week Bel Mooney advises a woman on how to tell her family she is seeing an older divorced dad of three.

item.title: Couple find an asylum seeker hidden in their bike rack
item.description: John and Debbie Marriott spent two weeks holidaying in their camper van. Nearing their home in Worthing, West Sussex, the pair joked about mysterious noises behind them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Better-informed people have less pandemic stress
item.description: Researchers from the Ohio State University found that learning more about the virus helped people reduce their feelings of uncertainty - which reduced their stress.

item.title: RAY MASSEY: New Toyota Yaris dodges the cardinal sin of being boring
item.description: Toyota's anglophile president Akio Toyoda, who when living and working in London in the Eighties used to whizz around in an original Mini, wanted to add some pizzazz to the new Yaris.

item.title: Eat Out To Help Out scheme serves 10.5m meals in its first three days
item.description: The number of people visiting pubs, cafes and restaurants has tripled in a month as Rishi Sunak's Eat Out To Help Out scheme has inspired workers to leave their homes and spend.

item.title: Fitness buff builds £1bn Gymshark clothes brand from parents' garage
item.description: After being taught to sew by his mother, Ben Francis and a group of friends set up Gymshark when he was just 19. US private equity giant General Atlantic has snapped up a 21 per cent stake.

item.title: 2014 Taliban massacre survivor wins place at Oxford University
item.description: Ahmad Nawaz, 19, almost lost an arm when the Taliban unleashed fury at his school in Peshawar, Pakistan in December 2014.

item.title: Leeds residents generate 50% more CO2 per day than Londoners
item.description: A team from Utility Bidder crunched the numbers to work out just how much CO2 we individually produce and which areas of the country have the highest levels.

item.title: Cold Feet star James Nesbitt pays tribute to his father as he dies aged 91
item.description: The Northern Irish actor, 55, has described his late father as a wonderful parent, teacher and friend as he honoured him in a statement on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Woman, 31, passes gets driving licence after SEVENTEEN tests
item.description: Blessing Platinum-Williams was finally handed a pass last month after embarking on an intensive course in Watford at the start of lockdown.

item.title: Staycationers are urged NOT to travel with roads into Devon and Cornwall at a standstill
item.description: Police officers were reportedly in pursuit of a silver Mazda shortly after 2pm on Friday in response to an emergency call when it began travelling in the wrong direction down the A3 before crashing.

item.title: Hyperion's 220mph hydrogen car runs 1,000 miles on a tank
item.description: Coming in 2022, the XP-1 from Hyperion can go from zero to 60mph in a staggering 2.2 seconds, reaching a top speed of more than 221mph. And the whisper-quiet car takes only minutes to refuel.

item.title: 11 migrants rounded up by police near Dover town centre
item.description: Tony Benson, who lives in Lens, a large town 100km from Calais, said he 'wished the group luck' after he drove up to the French coast to give away the dinghy to people trying to reach the UK.

item.title: Second World War veteran who survived kamikaze attacks dies aged 94 just three days before VJ Day
item.description: Richard Edser, 94, from Harlow in Essex, survived kamikaze attacks on board the HMS Formidable aircraft carrier during his service in East Asia.
item.media:description: Richard Edser, 94, who served on the HMS Formidable, died on August 12 (Taxi Charity/PA)

item.title: US confirms seizure of Iranian fuel on Venezuela-bound...
item.description: The US Justice Department on Friday confirmed it had seized the fuel cargo aboard four tankers sent by Iran to crisis-wracked Venezuela -the tankers Bella, Bering, Pandi and Luna.

item.title: Brad Pitt SLAMS Angelina Jolie's 'Hail Mary' filing as a 'tactical gambit' to delay custody trial
item.description: Brad Pitt has fired back at ex-wife Angelina Jolie via his legal team, after she filed a request to remove Judge John W. Ouderkirk from their almost four-year divorce battle on Thursday.

item.title: 'Courageous' D-Day veteran John Hutton dies aged 96 one year after parachuting into France
item.description: John Hutton, known by his friends as Jock, was 19 when he served in the 13th Lancashire Parachute Battalion during the Second World War.
item.media:description: Veteran Jock Hutton after taking part in a commemorative parachute descent over Sannerville, France, during commemorations for the 75th anniversary of the D-Day landings (Gareth Fuller/PA)

item.title: Boy, 2, dies after falling from ninth-floor east London flat
item.description: The toddler, thought to be aged two, fell around 4pm yesterday in Shoreditch, London, and was pronounced dead at the scene. Full circumstances surrounding the death are not yet known.

item.title: Paedophile jailed for life after 'manipulating' women into filming themselves abusing children
item.description: A judge told sexual predator James Jewell he posed such a danger to children he must serve at least six years and eight months when he was jailed for life at Maidstone Crown Court yesterday

item.title: Victoria's Secret accused of ripping off black-founded brands
item.description: Victoria's Secret put out lingerie items that look strikingly similar to pieces by British brand Edge o' Beyond. The brand's founder found a past purchase from a VS designer for those items.

item.title: 300lb woman shows off her body in crop tops and bikinis
item.description: Megan Fisher, 29, who lives in New York City, has never felt confident in her appearance, and spent years following fad diets to try and slim down.

item.title: John Lewis's flagship £35million store in Birmingham will never reopen after closing during lockdown
item.description: The high-end brand has confirmed all eight retail sites announced in July as at risk of closure, including the Grand Central store in Birmingham and its Watford branch, will never reopen.

item.title: Pictured: Churchgoer, 26, known as Gucci for his love of fashion label who was shot dead by gunman
item.description: Jeffrey Wegbe, 26, was found with a gunshot wound to his chest at the property in Kilburn, north west London on Wednesday morning. There have been no arrests.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Sandwich factory open despite 300 infections
item.description: Greencore, the UK's largest maker of pre-packed sandwiches, has said that production is 'continuing as usual' at the plant and it had no concerns about its products.

item.title: Pop-up market breaching 800-year-old law can continue to trade
item.description: Council have made a dramatic u-turn on their decision to ban Sileby market because of medieval law. Now five stalls will be allowed every Tuesday as that 'would not constitute a market'.

item.title: Hero who smashed car window to save distressed dog in heatwave says he 'knew he had to act'
item.description: Axe-wielding hero William Morris was seen saving a dog from a stranger's car at the Newbury Retail Park in Berkshire on Monday afternoon by smashing the window in a now-viral video.

item.title: Sir Matthew Bourne's Nutcracker! Christmas show is cancelled
item.description: Sir Matthew Bourne's dance company, New Adventures, announced that the national tour and Christmas season of Nutcracker! had been pushed back by a year.

item.title: Man, 21, arrested after pensioner found dead in Shropshire
item.description: Early on Friday police discovered the body of a man, in his 70s, on Brown Clee Hill in South Shropshire.

item.title: Grand Designs presenter Kevin McCloud's housing firm at risk
item.description: Grand Designs host Kevin McCloud, pictured, launched Happiness Architecture Beauty (HAB) in 2007 'to make homes that lift the spirits'. He has written to investors to say their money is at risk.

item.title: Man says travellers forced him into Tesco baby food blackmail
item.description: Nigel Wright, 45 is on trial at the Old Bailey for allegedly trying to extort nearly £1.5 million in cryptocurrency from the supermarket chain because he was angry at being underpaid for milk.

item.title: Turkey accuses France of 'bullying' after Macron sent navy to Mediterranean
item.description: Tensions in the Mediterranean have risen since Turkey sent a seismic vessel and a small navy fleet into the region on Monday (pictured, French and Greek ships in the Mediterranean).

item.title: Spring will be a 'new dawn' for Britain, says deputy chief medical officer
item.description: Professor Van Tam, the deputy chief medical officer for England, said the development of a working vaccine against Covid-19 could start to have an impact on daily life by Easter 2021.

item.title: Lightning strikes a palm tree on a clear day in Florida video
item.description: The unusual footage, referred to as a 'Bolt from the Blue' by meteorologists was captured from the inside of a Florida man's car, while he was around 75ft away from the strike.

item.title: Bomb disposal team are called to Sellafield nuclear site after explosive chemical discovered
item.description: Bomb disposal experts cleared Sellafield nuclear site in Cumbria after organic peroxide was found during a routine inspection.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon's pandemic: From gazumping ministers to using Westminster cash to boost popularity
item.description: The SNP leader has consistently out-maneuvered Boris Johnson's Government during the coronavirus pandemic but finds herself in hot water over France quarantine.

item.title: Boy abducted by woman in broad daylight in China is rescued
item.description: Chilling surveillance footage shows a woman speaking to the lost youngster before scooping him up in China's southern city Guangdong. The suspect has been detained.

item.title: Brazilian president Jair Bolosonaro's approval rating hits its highest ever amid Covid-19 crisis
item.description: A poll found that 37% of those surveyed viewed Bolsonaro's government as great or good - up from 32% in June. His rejection dropped to 34% viewing his government as bad or terrible.

item.title: 'Pro-Russian' paedophile, 54, sent letter to Theresa May containing fake poison
item.description: Dr Christopher Doyle, 54, sparked a counter-terrorism investigation when he posted an envelope containing white powder to Westminster. He denied adding the fake poison himself.

item.title: Two revellers dive into waterfall and disappear from sight to find themselves in pitch black cave
item.description: Frederic Esnault and Tshawe Bagwa, from Norway, were visiting the jungle around Port Antonio, Jamaica when they found a waterfall that flowed down into a hole in the rock.

item.title: Spain bans smoking in public nationwide and closes restaurants and bars
item.description: Spain's Health Minister Salvador Illa unveiled new measures to be enforced nationwide, including banning smoking in the street and closing discos, as the country's Covid-19 cases continue to rise.

item.title: Teenage traveller, 17, named after Rocky Marciano is jailed for life
item.description: Rocky Marciano Price, 17, has been sentenced at Preston Crown Court to life for the murder of Lindsay Birbeck, 47, and must serve a minimum of 16 years in custody.

item.title: Hero builder saves stranded dolphin after he heard it whistling at him while stuck in riverbed
item.description: Leon De Sola Pinto turned up to his building site on the banks of Helford River in Cornwall on August 10 and heard clicks coming from the river where he saw a dolphin stranded and needing help.

item.title: Puppies who mingle are less likely to be scared of fireworks and thunder
item.description: Pet owners in Finland were asked to fill out a questionnaire on their dog and ny anxiety-related behavioural problems the pet has and how they react to certain stimuli.

item.title: Social media 'doesn't increase mental health problems in teens'
item.description: In a study of 74,000 teens between 13 and 16 years old, US researchers found no association between depression symptoms and social media use.

item.title: Comedian Russell Howard storms out of gig just five minutes
item.description: The comedian noticed the woman in the audience filming him, while he was performing new material, about five minutes into the set on the outdoor terrace of the Bambalan bar in Bristol.

item.title: Warning over rising Covid-19 cases in locked-down Calderdale
item.description: Public Health England announced Newark and Sherwood, home to around 120,000 people, is now an 'area of concern'. It was one of 29 areas named on the watchlist.

item.title: Smartphone customizer unveils SpaceX-themed iPhone with Elon Musk's signature for nearly $6,000
item.description: Caviar is accepting pre-orders for its 'Musk be one Mars' SpaceX-themed iPhone 12 that pays tribute to Elon Musk and includes a small piece of the Dragon capsule on the titanium backing.

item.title: Renewable biogas from COW MANURE is injected into the UK Grid
item.description: The biomethane connected to the Gas National Transmission System at the end of July by anaerobic digestion company BioCow from a farm in Cambridgeshire.

item.title: July rise in Covid-19 cases in England has 'levelled off' again, data shows
item.description: Today's report from the Office for National Statistics said a rise in coronavirus cases in July has now 'levelled off' again and there is no evidence that the virus is surging in England.

item.title: Police arrest two men after 29-year-old man dies suddenly
item.description: Two men have been arrested after a man's body was recovered from Brassmil Lane in Bath, pictured. The 29-year-old victim was found dead on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Ministers quietly remove 1.3million coronavirus tests from their official figures
item.description: The double-counted tests were added between May 14 and August 12, but the total number of tests 'made available' before and after the adjustment is unclear.

item.title: Thai king commutes death sentence for Myanmar men in British tourist murder case
item.description: Two migrants from Myanmar on death row in Thailand for the murder of two British backpackers had their sentences commuted to life in prison. Zaw Lin and Win Zaw Htun were sentenced.

item.title: Ex-soldier founds Zimbabwe's female-only anti-poaching tribe
item.description: The Akashinga anti-poaching unit was founded by Australian ex-special forces soldier Damien Mander, who uses his experience serving in Iraq to train women to protect Zimbabwe's wildlife.

item.title: Mother cures twin boys' eczema with £5 'magic' moisturiser cure
item.description: Mother Charlotte Moreton, 28, from York, was delighted after discovering 'magic' moisturiser cure which instantly solved the eczema of her 11-month-old twins Tommy and Conan.

item.title: Wild boar that stole German nudist's clothes could be killed in part of cull
item.description: Photos of the female boar and her two young were shared thousands of times on social media after a naked sunbather was snapped unashamedly chasing after them to retrieve his laptop bag.

item.title: NASA shares stunning photos of Mars captured by its Reconnaissance Orbiter
item.description: Images were all taken of the Red Planet and its surroundings from space using equipment onboard the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter - which is the oldest spacecraft currently active around Mars.

item.title: Venice activists hold party to celebrate cruise lines pulling out
item.description: MSC Cruises and Costa Cruises announced this week that their first Mediterranean trips after a months-long hiatus due to the coronavirus pandemic would depart from Genoa and Trieste.

item.title: Prince William wishes Child Bereavement trustee the 'best of luck'
item.description: Prince William, 38, appeared on the charity's Instagram page in a short message where he wished the 'best of luck' to trustee Alexander Fitzgibbons, who is embarking on a journey to raise money.

item.title: Couple renovating home at breaking point and £40K down after rogue builder leaves it uninhabitable
item.description: Mother-of-two Charlotte Rudolph, 41, from Bath, and her partner Sam Peacock told FEMAIL they have rented four-and-a-half years and purchased their 'forever home' in January for £287,500.

item.title: Black DJ fears she was racially profiled by her neighbours
item.description: Kaylee Golding, 22, who has presented for BBC Radio 1's Early Breakfast, had only just moved from Birmingham into the flat in Newham, east London, ten days earlier when the officers turned up.

item.title: Ministers accused of 'losing control' of immigration as cash handouts act as 'no lose pull factor'
item.description: Migration Watch UK said only a tiny minority of those who arrived illegally by boat have been removed since Prime Minister Boris Johnson warned last August: 'We will send you back.'

item.title: Cyclist Tim Declercq shows off bruises after being caught in hailstorm
item.description: Professional cyclist Tim Leclerq has shown off the gruesome bruises left behind by giant hailstones after a storm battered stage two of the Criterium du Dauphine in France.

item.title: Russia fights to stop an outbreak of bubonic plague by vaccinating 32,000 people
item.description: Bubonic plague has been detected in Siberia including an area where it has not been seen since monitoring began 62 years ago. The rush to vaccinate comes after two deaths in Mongolia.

item.title: British tourist, 30, falls 500ft from a cliff to his death in popular Ibiza beauty spot
item.description: A Liverpool man, named locally as Richard Lloyd Canavan, 30, died instantly after falling nearly 500 feet from cliffs near a lookout point at Cala d'Hort on Ibiza's south coast.

item.title: SUV sideswipes approaching van causing it to veer into oncoming traffic and miss pickup truck
item.description: Footage shows a red SUV turning left across traffic and going into the outside lane in Piedmont, Oklahoma. A red van was already occupying that lane and as SUV crashes into its side.

item.title: Bon appétit! Diners share the hilarious snaps of the moment requests were executed VERY literally
item.description: Diners from around the world have been sharing the hilarious snaps of the moment they received their orders which had been executed very literally by restaurant and cafe staff.

item.title: Tricky brainteaser challenges puzzlers to spot the Devon-style scone with the cream before the jam
item.description: The puzzle, created by UK-based company Leisure Cookers, shows Cornish-style scones, with just a single Devon version hiding somewhere within the colourful scene.

item.title: Pub accused of racism as black cyclists were refused table
item.description: Julian Konten, 48, was out with Dale Miller and Chris Harper (pictured) when they tried to get a drink at the Captain's Wife pub in Sully, Glamorgan, during their bike ride.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper murder: MP calls for 20 years' jail for killers
item.description: Conservative MP John Howell met Debbie Adlam on Monday to discuss the family's campaign for 'Andrew's Law', calling for those who kill police officers to face a minimum of 20 years in prison.

item.title: Police officer who was hit by hijacked car supports calls for harsher sentences for cop killers
item.description: PC Gareth Phillips, who was run over by a car thief, said he was 'totally' behind the campaign launched by PC Harper's widow for police killers to receive an automatic life sentence with no parole.

item.title: Outrage as solicitor says PC Andrew Harper's family got justice
item.description: Sophie Khan, a solicitor and director of Police Action Centre, tweeted that it was wrong to suggest Andrew Harper's family had faced injustice when his killers were jailed for manslaughter

item.title: Government plans to end automatic one-third reduction for guilty pleas
item.description: Justice Secretary Robert Buckland is reportedly studying proposals to end the current practice of reducing jail sentences by one third.
